review_text: Nice experience with an even better taste. Some seem to disagree but I couldn't see why. Press the button on your table and the staff is there within seconds to help you with anything you'd need. The chicken sate came with one of the best sauce I have ever tasted. The pork egg rolls were yummy and the Kao Soy was spicy and delicious. The drinks are good too, definitely worth a try!

This isn't my first time here at Kao Soy Nimman but it is my first time dropping the review. I've tried Kao soy from so many places around Chiang Mai, but honestly, Kao Soy Nimman is the best one yet. I get why it‚Äôs so famous...and now I 100% agree with all the hype üëç The broth is rich, creamy, not too thick or liquidly and it's full of flavor, the noodles are perfectly cooked, and that crispy topping adds the perfect crunch. Everything just comes together so well. **Don't underestimate their chilli** Even though it‚Äôs already super popular with both locals and tourists, it really deserves the extra fame. If you‚Äôre in Chiang Mai and want to taste the best Kao Soy OR Khao Soi, this is the spot. Totally recommend! üëç

It's a very famous restaurant in the area, known for the dish that gives the place its name. Because of its fame, it's almost always crowded, so it's common to find a small queue at the entrance.Luckily, the line moved quickly, and we didn't wait long to be seated. The service was good and attentive. We tried the famous Khao Soi: it was tasty, and the ingredients seemed high-quality, but honestly, it wasn't excellent. Given the restaurant's reputation, I was expecting a bit more. It's good, but not the best I've had. They accept card payments.

Tried the Khao Soi Chicken and the Chicken Satay Peanut Sauce Noodle both were amazing. The Khao Soi had rich standard coconut curry broth, crispy noodles on top, and super tender chicken. The balance of spice, creaminess, and a squeeze of lime was just perfect. The Satay Peanut Noodles were such a nice surprise!!!! creamy, nutty, slightly sweet, with grilled chicken that had that smoky flavor 9/10. A great fusion of comfort food and Thai street style. Nice cozy spot with warm Chiang Mai vibes. Perfect for anyone who loves flavorful northern Thai food. Highly recommend adding this place to your food list when you‚Äôre in town! Food looks as good as it tastes check the photos that I took here.

I had Oder Chicken Satay,Ong Pu(Crab) , Beef KHAO Soi , Iced Dessert . Actually, I think the KHAO SoI weren't as good as I expected; everyone has their own preferences. I am more like to eat that noodle I‚Äôm tried at Chiang Rai. KHAO Soi 4 Stars Iced Dessert 5 Stars!!!! Chicken Satay 3 Stars Ong Pu 1 Stars (This is not something I would eat.) Staff Service Good & Helpful

The KaoSoi (Chiang Mai curry-like noodle ) here is one notch higher and premium quality and more varieties with other stir fried dishes which are equally good. It‚Äôs more like a restaurant rather than a noodle bistro. The food are pretty good and yummy, I gave it almost 10pts . A bit on a touristy and pricey side but is worth it. Nicely decorated, clean and staffs able to speak English.

Had to try Khao Soi Nimman because our driver recommended it‚Äîand it‚Äôs super close to our hotel! If you come to Northern Thailand and don‚Äôt try Khao Soi, it‚Äôs like you didn‚Äôt really make it here. We went for chicken Khao Soi, braised beef Khao Soi, stir-fried pumpkin leaves with oyster sauce, crispy ruby dessert in coconut milk, and fresh coconut water. Absolute must-try!

The best Kao Soy I‚Äôve ever had. The spiciness of the soup was perfectly balanced‚Äîneither overpowering nor too mild. Its consistency struck the right note as well, being neither too thick nor too watery. The two types of noodles, one firm and the other soft, added depth and variety to each bite. Midway through, the topping of lemon slices, onions, and pickled vegetables refreshed the flavor, making the bowl enjoyable from start to finish. Although about ten people were waiting outside, our turn came in just around 20 minutes.

A nice variety of curry noodles, with flavors that are rich and satisfying; although a little on the salty side after finishing the meal. A must-try here is the Thai-style omelet, very juicy, flavorful, and generously filled with pork! Indoor air-conditioned seating is limited, so it can be a bit hard to get a comfortable spot during busy hours. Overall, it‚Äôs a good place to experience authentic local curry noodles in Chiang Mai.

This restaurant deserves to get its first Michelin star! All the products were not only very tasty, but the products also contained a unique blend of Norhern Thai-style flavors (which are in my opinion the better dishes of Thailand). We felt really treated like kings. The service was impeccable and no waiting thanks to the digital bell on our dining table. As a starter, we ate the soft, creamy and scrumptious eggplant salad, which I can really recommend to vegetarians. Also the chicken skewers with satay sauce was a great addition to our order, with a wink to the original chicken-satay skewers from Indonesia. Even the pickled veggies let me think of the Indonesian dishes for a while. However, I have to confess that I personally prefer an Indonesian-style satay sauce. For our main course we had a great stir-fried chicken dish with a great combination of spices. To add more spice to our dinner, we had the delicious Kang Nor curry dish. I really like this curry for the added bamboo sprouts and dried fish. As a non-pork eater, I obviously chose this fish-variety. However, they also have a pork-variety. My boyfriend and I were seated inside. The restaurant was well climatized and very clean. You could even look through the glass, where you could see the diligent people working hard to make exquisite dishes. Even the dining tables were of another kind of level. At the end of our dinner we realized that we had been sitting on a ‚Äòremade‚Äô authentic sewing table. It gives the restaurant so much more atmosphere. As a dessert, I ate colored soft noodles in sweet coconut milk. I must say that this type of dessert, has it all to me. We went to our hotel totally satisfied, joyful and fully fed. I can assure everyone that you will enjoy your meal here to the highest level!

Best satay chicken and dessert in town. We also ordered 2 koh soi and were really tasty. The place can get a bit crowded cuz apparently it is a highly recommended place. So be prepared to wait a bit if you come for dinner. But definitely worth visiting!

What can I say... I think there is a management problem in this restaurant. After being seated, we had to call someone after 15 minutes because no one seemed to want to take our order. No hello. The staff waits for orders with their arms behind their backs against trees or walls. We chose to try the kao soy because we know it well. What a surprise when the dish arrived, we would have said half a portion with say 5 tablespoons of sauce maximum. Also, we decided to try a dessert. Likewise, no one came to ask us if we wanted something... yet many staff were available and we had to call them. And as you can see from the pictures, no one cleared the meal / table before and during dessert. There are other places much better in terms of taste, service and price in Chang Mai.

Must eat for anyone wanting to taste authentic northern Thai cuisines. Their Khao soy is rich and creamy, perfectly balanced between coconut milk and spices. Definitely a go to spots for Khao soy lovers in Chiang Mai.
We loved the food! Kao soy with beef was sooo delicious! l loved the aubergine salad and chicken satay was also good with its sauces. Service is very quick also‚Ä¶ Lovely place!

Great place for gourmet noodles. Off course a hype because it is Michelin recommended, but the dishes are really good and very moderate priced. The staff seems to be less happy with all the attention and refrain from any smile...

Tourist trap with inflated prices and bland food. We ordered three different khao sois and a variety of sides and the noodles were overcooked and the food was lukewarm. Also because of the outdoor location and standing water, the restaurant is a breeding ground for mosquitoes that will attack you relentlessly üò≠

Absolutely delicious kao soi! I have tried some other places before but they were so spicy. This place could make "less spicy" for me and it was heavenly. I finished the meal in 10 min. Very tender braised beef. Flavorful soup. Crispy and soft noodles. I will come back to here anytime I get to visit Chiang Mai again. It's that good.

Almost every tourist comes here to eat. The prices are a bit higher than other Northern Thai places. The decor and vibe are really nice. The Khao Soi is pretty spicy, and the other dishes are quite strong in flavor too. Worth a try if you‚Äôre around, but if there‚Äôs a long line, you can skip it.

1350 for 3 different Kao soy, 2 mixed platters and calamari. Everything was nice enough except the calamari. Kao soy was like a Malaysian curry mee (not laksa) with a thicker and plainer broth. The noodles and crunch is nice though. The silkworms were nice and crispy with a bit of salt flavour. Northern Thai sausage platter was average in textures and taste but the dips made up for it. The chicken satay was nice enough but nothing special. The black rice is like a Bak chang so not a fan. Pork floss and onion ring were quite nice. Pork rind was normal. Calamari batter was not sticking and while crispy lacked flavour. Service was a bit slow when getting the bill. Had to ask 3 different people before we got the bill.

Food: 10/10 Atmosphere: 8/10 The best noodle you can find in Chiang Mai. Amazing side dishes too. The restaurant is big, but always crowded so you may have to wait for tables. But it‚Äôs totally worth it in my opinion.

the one that still open in the evening, the broth very rich and typical of khao soi that you can really enjoy, the chicken also so tender and the sauce really fresh and yummy. the place have indoor and outdoor, but indoor kinda small and packed, so better to dine in in the outside.

The kao soy and that ocra flower juice was very tasty, I love it. Also the waitresses were kind, but I can‚Äôt say the same about the environment. All tables in the shop were taken and we had to sit outside, and there were too many mosquitoes around. After I had this meal I had to go to the pharmacy to reduce my itchiness.
Overall a very nice khao soy. Highly recommend the beef one. One of the best khao soy we tried. The beef grill was also super delicious.

Best local restaurant in Chiang Mai! A must go when you‚Äôre here! Amazing Khao Soi with tons of variations. The crab roe dish was delicious too! Very unique! Highly recommended for anyone looking for delicious authentic food and a great ambiance. Max wait time is 10-15 min, not too bad.
Very good restaurant with northern Thai cuisine The fried chicken pieces and grilled pork was especially good Service and atmosphere was also nice Large portions too!

Table management is quite systematic, you can call the waiter by pressing the button (but it takes time for them to come) Food, I would say it's authentic Northern Thai Style food. With its open kitchen you can see the cleanliness. Price, well it's not a normal food stall or street food. So the price is reasonable.

Exceptional traditional northern style restaurant with a Michelin guide recommendation. It's both traditional looking and smart and the service is friendly. I ordered the softshell crab Khao soi and the ong pu, grilled paddy crab head butter. Both excellent dishes, well presented and tasted phenomenal. The ong pu in particular was creamy, intense and felt luxurious. Will definitely be back.

This bustling Northern Thai eatery delivers a lively, tourist-friendly intro to Kao Soi. The Super Bowl featured an assortment of grilled pork, chicken leg, and squid which offers a creamy, slightly sweet coconut-curry broth with firm egg noodles is approachable for newcomers, though purists might miss traditional depth. Portions are generous, and seating was immediate during our 2pm visit. Don‚Äôt skip the aromatic chicken satay skewers - tender white meat with a zesty chili-shallot dip. Highlights include the crab shell roe (tiny but intensely savory) and the peeled coconut‚Äîa refreshing, Instagrammable orb in a chilled metal cup. The vibe is energetic, with English menus and swift service, though prices lean higher than local joints. The ambience was pretty with all the overhanging ferns and plants however seated outdoors, there were a little too many flies around for comfort. Small eaters can share the Super Bowl (it‚Äôs huge!), skip the crab roe unless craving novelty, and visit mid-afternoon to avoid crowds. Ideal for first-timers seeking a hassle-free Kao Soi experience, but seasoned diners might prefer hole-in-the-wall authenticity. Still, a solid choice for flavorful, filling meals in a vibrant setting.

TL;DR: Tasty meal in a comfortable atmosphere. Kao Soy Nimman has an extensive menu. More options than I expected. We settled on the Kao Soy Gai (chicken) and an order of chicken satay and beef skewers. We enjoyed all of the dishes. Service was friendly and helpful. Overall, it was a good meal. A solid 3.5 - 4 stars!
Very tasty food, but there were many dishes that ran out, all dishes are spicy.
One of the good tom yum goong, mango sticky rice was fresh. I loved the gardenia flower tea. Refreshing. The pork popiah was so good and filling. Perfect snack for beer ü§™

My first Khao soi! Delicious curry broth paired with chewy egg noodles! I ordered the stewed beef Khao soi and even though it was extra yummy, I can just eat the noodles with the broth alone! Ordered the Thai omelette as well but I was too big for 1 person to finish üòÜ. Thank you for letting my taste buds experience new flavour!
Very touristy spot. EVERY KOREAN content creators recommended this place so I visited. The noodle I had had ‚Äúfor tourist‚Äù taste. It‚Äôs pricey too.

One of the greatest restaurants I‚Äôve ever been to! The Khao Soi was amazing‚ÄîI‚Äôve never had anything like it. Everything we ordered was fantastic. We got the beef skewers, but now I know we should‚Äôve gotten the chicken skewers like everyone else. Overall, it was an amazing experience. We got there at 3 p.m. and only had to wait 30 minutes. Make sure to get a ticket from the staff when you arrive!

Housed in trendy Nimman, this is one of Chiang Mai‚Äôs Michelin-picked noodle playground that gives a modern spin to the Northern Thai classic: khao soi‚Äîa dish rooted in Lanna history, once brought over by Chinese-Muslim traders, now a Chiang Mai must-eat. Kicked things off with the Octopus Khao Soi‚Äîbecause why be normal when you can have tentacles in your soup? The octopus was chewy, not salty and a little bougie in the best way laying on top of a coconut curry hot tub. Then came the classic hero: the Chicken Khao Soi. A+ comfort food. That broth? Creamy, warm, just the right punch of spice. At some parts, the slurping was wishing the broth had just one more ladle of richness. Ended with a tropical pool party where the Thub Thim Krob came in like a treasure chest disguised as a dessert bowl.Signature ruby water chestnuts (crunchy, chewy, glorious) Grass jelly, cendol, and nata de coco and golden jackfruit pieces all vibing in one icy, sweet coconut milk party. Was definitely pleasing to the eyes but flavour wise went a little under. Still‚Äîworth the visit, especially if you‚Äôre khao soi-curious or full-on obsessed with the michelin adventure! Zoom off with a grab-bike ride that gives u more than local vibes üòâ
Delicious Northern Thai curry noodles üëç Every dish ordered is delicious üòã Worth tastingüëç

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è (4/5 stars rating) I recently had dinner at ‚ÄúKao Soy Nimman‚Äù with my partner, and it was a mixed experience. From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere was inviting and cozy, with a delightful blend of traditional Thai decor and efficient but unattractive (to the point) service ‚Äîwe got no help with recommendations and had to call service several times. üåø‚ú® Let's start with the beverages. Despite their small selection, the fresh coconut water was refreshing, and the tea was perfect for the appetizers. üçπüçµ The regular beers were also cold and refreshing. As for the food, it was truly spectacular! Each dish was a testament to Thai culinary craftsmanship. The ‚ÄúMo Wah Pork Jerky‚Äù was expertly done, with a perfect caramelization that added a delightful sweetness and crunch to every bite. üçñüíé The highlight of our meal was undoubtedly the ‚ÄúKai Soy Stewed Beef.‚Äù The creamy sauce was nothing short of delicious, and the beef was tender and flavorful, melting in our mouths with each bite. It was a dish that left us craving more. üç≤üêÑ We also ordered the ‚ÄúPork Beef Grilled,‚Äù which, although flavorful, had a bit more fat than we preferred. However, the rich taste of the meat more than compensated for this slight inconvenience. ü•©üî• Overall, "Kao Soy Nimman" delivered a mixed dining experience, with nice Thai food but regular service and restaurant atmosphere. We would recommend it when looking for something quick and delicious, no fancy or exotic ! üåüüáπüá≠ Pros: - Delicious and well-prepared dishes üçΩÔ∏è - Quick service - Inviting and cozy atmosphere üåø - Authentic Thai flavors üáπüá≠ Cons: - Short selection of beverage üçπ - Brief and to the point service, unattractive or unwelcoming (we had to ask constantly, empty plates were there until asked to be removed)
Great atmosphere. Portion is big, price is gd, and more importantly taste is great!
kao soy was served really quickly and the pork skewers is a must!!! personally it was more tastier than the noodles

Michelin accredited for year 2020 and year 2021. Not afterwards anymore? Crowded with tourists. Decent colorful menu. Both air conditioned indoor seats and outdoor open air seats. Kai Soy tastes just fair and in small portions. Fresh coconut juice is in nice presentation but of unstable quality. Young and soft coconut meat for the first order but old and very hard meat for the second order. There is a service bell on the table. Funny sound of pressing it, lol. Tried a few time but no waiter responded to it. You still have to wave your hands for service. Beware of mosquitoes bites if you sit outside. Bathroom is quite terrible. Dirty sewage everywhere.

Beautiful atmosphere and outdoor seating. Food came quick, khao soi was nice and the chicken satay is a must try. It was incredibly juicy and tender. The calamari was also good but chewy compared to the calamari in the Khoi soi that was very tender. Thai tea was solid, sweet and strong but not overly sweet.
It‚Äôs not traditional Northern Thai food. There‚Äôs usually a queue at lunchtime on weekdays. Khao Soi ‚Äì 95B. We ordered two khao soi and a spring roll.

Dish was average, unfortunately not creamy like authentic recipe should be. Unfortunately had a disappointing experience: while explaining to me no table changes allowed, the staff gave a very unhappy faced & sighed very loudly directly at me. No voice was raised by anyone. Definitely left an appalling impression.

This restaurant has an amazing Northern Thai menu, but is especially well known for its many choices regarding their speciality dish, Kao Soi. You can order it almost any way that you like, with or without meat. They offer Kao Soi with tofu, mushrooms, or just vegetables for all of us vegetarians. There are other vegetarian options on their menu, also. We really enjoyed the vegetable Thai omelette! Very delicious! It‚Äôs a busy place because it is so popular, so arrive early if you don‚Äôt like to wait. Service was very good because every table has a call button for the waiters, and they always respond almost immediately. Prices were very good, too. We will definitely return here and recommend this place to others.

Khaosoy itself is ok, a lot less spicy compared to other khaosoy places. Im Thai, the overall taste is quite bland for me, but I assume tourists might like it. Chicken satay is very bland.üòÖ Good service. (if not rushing hours ofc) Price is normal, portion is normal, not too much or too less.
If you looking for some traditional Thai food, Kao Soy Nimman is an option that‚Äôs worth trying. The food served kinda quick but the staffs are bit busy so you have to be patient.

Kao Soy Nimman is a must-visit for anyone looking to experience the authentic flavors of Northern Thailand. This charming restaurant delivers the perfect blend of tradition and taste, making it a standout spot for Thai food lovers. The Food Their signature dish, Kao Soy, is a masterpiece. The creamy, curry-like broth is rich with spices, perfectly balanced, and full of depth. The crispy noodles on top add a delightful crunch, while the tender meat melts in your mouth. Every spoonful is packed with the bold, authentic flavors that define Northern Thai cuisine. The Drinks Adding to the experience, drinks are served in traditional Thai-style bowls. This small but thoughtful detail enhances the cultural vibe of the meal, making it feel special and unique. Whether you opt for a Thai iced tea or a refreshing herbal drink, the presentation is sure to impress. Why Visit? ‚Ä¢ Authentic Taste: The Kao Soy here truly captures the essence of Northern Thai flavors. ‚Ä¢ Unique Presentation: Serving drinks in Thai traditional bowls adds a fun and cultural touch. ‚Ä¢ Great Atmosphere: The warm and inviting ambiance makes it a great place for a casual meal or introducing friends to Thai cuisine.
Ordered the following: Khao soi beef (best) Khao soi pork Chicken satay Omellete with pork Must order - khao soi beef! The rest you can skip.

Visited on local recommendation. The food was outstanding, the best chicken Kao Soy we‚Äôve had. Also try the chicken satay and drinks, very good. If you‚Äôre heat sensitive ask for the air conditioned room.
The local curry noodle is very tasty. But the best is the desert, a must try.

I should start this review by saying I‚Äôve been in thailand for over 2 months and I have had a lot of great meals - including delicious khao sois here in Chang mai and I definitely do not say this is one of them. The portions are VERY small and the price is high for what they offer. I found this khao soi very mediocre. It‚Äôs not bad. It is just nothing special at all. I believe this place is overrated and I had a feeling it would be‚Ä¶ but I decided to give it a try and believe in the reviews. I was wrong. People keep coming because there are some good reviews and, if they had not had a chance of actually having a good thai meal or a rich khao soi, they would think this one is good. Believe me, its not. And if you come to this restaurant and there is a line, dont wast your precious time.
The best Khao Soi we had in Chiang Mai (which says a lot because they were all great). It is slightly more expensive than other places we tried but the taste in return is definitely worth it.

Really enjoyed the pork, the portion size was on the smaller side but for $95 I thought it was fine for the area. The chicken skewers were large and moist, very good and came with 8 at $95 that‚Äôs not too bad per skewer! To me the only down side was that it was very busy, but only waited about 15min and it took a long time to get the check

I tried the chicken satay and their signature khao soi‚Äîboth were delicious. The khao soi had a rich, creamy curry broth with crispy noodles and tender chicken, while the satay was juicy and flavorful with a tasty peanut sauce.
Some of the best northern Thai food I've had! The Khao SOI was delicious but the garlic pepper pork and Thai northern sausages were heavenly! One of the best meals I've had in Thailand

Michelin-rated restaurant. Visited on 28 Feb 2025 at 6pm. High turnover, so don‚Äôt have to wait too long. We saw many tourists and some locals having their meal here. Tables were re-purposed from old sewing machines. Eight of us had a bowl of the famous Kao Soy Kai (curry noddlenwith chicken leg), as well as some side dishes to share: steamed herbal beef shank, chicken satay, kai jeow moo sab (minced pork Thai omelette). The Kao Soy Kai is a mixture of crispy noodle and normal yellow noodle. Blended well curiously. The ingredients were fresh, and the meat dishes were cooked well. We also ordered a drink each, and some dessert to share. Disappointed that the mango sticky rice was sold out. Price wise, it is reasonable: total of about 2,800 baht or 350 baht per person.

Delicious khao soi at reasonable rates! One bowl costs somewhere around 100 baht & it's very filling with a sufficient quantity of protein! You can also opt for a vegetarian one if you'd like! The curry (broth) of the khao soi is flavorful and is definitely the USP of this restaurant. I also tried their chicken satay which tasted tender and slightly sweet. Great, overall! I visited on a weekday evening and did not see any queues/wait time. Service is quick with efficient & polite waiters!

This is a popular place to eat, we arrive 30 minutes early for dinner with friends.. there was a long queue ahead of us, and because one member of our party had a plane to catch, we wanted to avoid being delayed, but as soon as we joined the queue we were shown to a table for 4.. this was because the people ahead of us needed a much larger table together. This was fine, there was no pressure to 'free' the table, we had drinks while we waited.. 1 x beer and 1 x Grass Jelly Juice (A strange drink as it came in a bowl filled with ice and jelly strips that resembles slugs and a dark liquid, but it was quite refreshing - needed both a straw and a spoon). Our friends arrived, and food was ordered.... 3 x Kao Soy Stewed Beef, 1x Kao Soy Poo-Nim ( which is a soft-shelled crab dish), Sai Oua (this is spicy sausage), Kai Satay (chicken on skewers with peanutbutter sauce). More drinks: another Beer, Soda Water and 2 x Passion Fruit Juices. The dishes were delicious.. really good fresh, tasty food. The prices seemed reasonable, we did eat a lot (a dish each and 2 shared dishes plus 1 or 2 drinks each) and the bill came to baht 1275.. that's about baht 320 each. The atmosphere was lively, there was a lot of staff around to help, and they were so polite and efficient. We will be returning to try other dishes on the menu.
Amazing kao soy, really good food. Nice atmosphere and staff. I would recommend it ü´∂üèª

The best khao soi of our trip, thanks to the recommendation from the local massage aunty. Guess it lives up to its Michelin Guide recognition, with a queue forming even before the shop opens. The beef khao soi was especially delicious, with super tender meat. The chicken thigh version was good too, though I preferred the beef. The fried egg with pork was just okay. Coconut was fresh!

Delicious bowl of Kao Soy. Just the right amount of chilli kick. The chicken leg was tender with the meat falling right off. We ordered the chicken satay as well it was grilled to perfection. We sat inside, which is air conditioned. Clean with hygiene. 100% recommend.

Well‚Ä¶the other restaurant was closing but I really wanted to get my friends Kao Soy because I had been telling them about it before their trip! 2020 and 2021 Michelin star restaurant! Absolutely delicious!
Had the best Khao Soi we had in Chiang mai, we also visited other more popular spots but this place was by far the best we had !

Very nice khao soi, but I have to say that portions are small. If you are a good eater, it might be difficult to be full unless you ask for more dishes. If busy, you got number and have to wait until tables are available. No card accepted.

This used to be my favorite Khao soi in Chiang Mai but the last time I went it had changed. Perhaps because it got too popular. The servers were very abrupt (not not nice either, but also not as kind as I remember them to be ‚Äî though it was adequate). Not bad by any means, just that I no longer feel the longing to return now‚Ä¶
My favorite khao soy whenever I visit Chiang Mai. Various menu and all tasty. Long queue during weekend. Better come weekday. Good atmosphere and good price.

Kao Soy Nimman, highlighted in the Michelin Guide, is a notable spot to experience khao soi in Chiang Mai. Michelin recognition attests to its quality and consistent appeal among locals and tourists. Khao soi itself is significant in Chiang Mai and Northern Thailand, known for its coconut-based curry broth, rich spices, and soft-crunchy noodle texture. A unique fusion of Thai and Burmese culinary influences, khao soi is cherished as a warm, hearty dish and has become an iconic part of Chiang Mai‚Äôs food culture, symbolizing local heritage and flavor. While it‚Äôs tourist-friendly and conveniently located, some visitors feel it‚Äôs slightly pricier than local spots nearby. It‚Äôs a recommended stop for travelers looking to try authentic Thai flavors.
Great kao soy! We had the sausage one and it was amazing. Staff are friendly and attentive. The food came super quick. Slightly pricey but worth it. Would recommend!!
The Khao Soi was so good I had to order a second bowl. Good satay and northern sausage too but the Khao Soi was just perfect.

Visited on saturday 2pm, some queue, waited less than 10 minutes to get table. Get your queue number when you arrive. We ordered chicken kao soi, pork kao soi, chicken satay and butterfly pea flower lime juice. Kao soi: nice flavour, curry. Egg noodles in curry topped with crispy noodles and salted preserved vegetables. Chicken satay: tender, but lacks flavour or charred taste im used to. One of the skewers is raw inside, notified staff. Staff was apologetic and offered not to charge the satay. Hopefully, i won't get food poisoning ü•≤üò≠ Butterfly pea flower lime juice: refreshing

A very good michelin guide shop to enjoy our dinner at here, Went early for early dinner so the queue is not long, Just wait about 10 minutes for our seatü•≥ The khao soi broth is very thick n spicy, good a chill weatherüòé

Very spicy soups üå∂Ô∏è ! The waiter told that a little, but it‚Äôs not little for western people. It‚Äôs very spicy ü•µ and taste of Khao soy is nothing special, ate more tastier and creamy in CM. Overrated, because of Michelin.
I really recommend, very good restaurant, really delicious taste. we will be back

Soup was not hot and neither was the chicken thigh, feels like they just drop the chicken in the soup before serving the khao soi. What‚Äôs a good bowl of noodles if the soup is not hot? The meat isn‚Äôt marinated in the soup or so tender it just breaks off the bone. I‚Äôve had better khao soi, made the mistake of coming here in convenience of distance, I can do better, we can do better.
Lovely place, good food at not super expensive prices. Wide selection of Kao Soy dishes. The place gets crowded quickly in the evenings, both inside and outside areas. Definitely worth a try!

This place is really crowded and always active !! We tired our first Khao Soi here since it was Michelin guided. We had to take tokens for the seat , we thought it would take long time so we walked around turns out we missed our no. and had to take another token . While waiting for our turn many people whose token were before us weren‚Äôt there so our turn came really quick in 5 minutes or so . Khao Soi here is really flavorful and delicious!

Khao soy lived up to its reputation. Taste is perfect. We had fried pork but our daughter‚Äôs stewed pork was better. Quantity matches price. We were glad we ordered chicken satay (dipping sauce delicious) and fried egg rolls. They were out of mango and sticky rice. We had to wait about twenty minutes at 7:00 on Saturday night. Mostly tourist customers and high price. Food taste is so so, not bad and not good. Curry is not creamy and thick enough.
Best Khao Soi, satay, and coconut desserts I've ever had! There is quite a line and expect a wait of at least 30 minutes to maybe several hours on a busy weekend.

I believe this is one of the best Khao Soi spots in Chiang Mai‚Äîtruly delicious. The Khao Soi soup is wonderfully thick, and the noodles are cooked to perfection. I ordered the shrimp version, and it did not disappoint. The Kanom Jeen Nam Ngiew (Thai rice noodles with pork broth and spicy tomatoes) was equally impressive. I also tried the black jelly, which had a nice level of sweetness. This black jelly is made from a local herbal plant and originates from the lower part of northern Thailand. Overall, it was a fantastic experience, and I highly recommend it.
Khao Soi was just okay. The servers didn‚Äôt say a word ‚Äî not even an apology. Ants were crawling on the table. Two big pieces of fat sat in a small dish.
Do not like the food. Grilled pork was hard and too salty. The buncha like dipping dish was pretty sad too. The dip was not hot enough. Omelette was just flour. Another level of sad.
Very yummy food, and cute place. Price is affordable for a Michelin star restaurant.

15/11 come in the afternoon for lunch but too many people waiting, and I come in 5pm, there‚Äôs no need to wait for the seat. Order 3 dishes , and find that taste is just average. Not worth for queuing long hour but if no need to queue, you can try once.
